New Records: Jasprit Bumrah returned to international cricket and took two wickets in his first two deliveries.
Key Match Events: Rain interrupted the match after India had scored 46 runs in 6.5 overs.
India won by 2 runs via the DLS method after the match was called off due to heavy rain.
Jasprit Bumrah and Paul Sterling shook hands under umbrellas to conclude the match.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was played at Malahide Cricket Club, Dublin.
Jasprit Bumrah was back after a layoff and made an impact with two quick wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: India took a 1-0 lead in the series.
Jasprit Bumrah's impressive return and Barry McCarthy's 51-run innings were key highlights.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Heavy rain and the subsequent DLS method decided the outcome.
The match was called off early due to weather conditions.
Others: The match was the first of the series between India and Ireland.
